titleStmt.title: Hugh Craycraft et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9035

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
We the undersigned citizens of Greenup County, would respectfully represent, to his Excellency, the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, that George Lemiblin, a Frenchman of Greenup County, was found Guilty of Larceny, at the July term of the Greenup Circuit, and was Sentenced to ^confinement in^ the State, penitentiary for the period of years the facts of his conviction, are as follows, the prisoner is a man of humble circumstances, is inductrious, & regarded as a man of honesty, But was intoxicated, when he killed the sheep, for which he was convicted, he killed the sheep in presence of some two or three persons, and Everything in the whole case indicates, no felonious intent on the part of the accused to Defraud the owner out of the value of the sheep, everything connected with the killing of the sheep was open & public, we therefore under
under the circumstances, recomend him as a fit subject for Executive Clemency, and petition, his pardon

Hugh Craycraft --
By -- W. C. Ireland
August Lamblin
By W. C. Ireland -- at his request.
Wm. F Harding
Harvey McAllister
By W F Harding
Len Barney
By Samuel Valence
Samuel Hunter
By Wm F Harding

Pettn of Citizens of Greenup County for Pardon of G. B. Lamblin for larceny

Evidence before jury not here
See Mr Ireland
